intro: Symphytonema, commonly known as the "buttercup fern," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble those of a fern, though it is not a true fern. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by specialized bracts. Symphytonema thrives in moist, shady environments, typically found in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it a unique and visually appealing addition to botanical gardens and natural habitats.
